dict.string:
With the Outback and the Forester going gangbusters, Subaru takes the next logical step and introduces a three-row family vehicle, the B9 Tribeca (later just Tribeca). Developed jointly with GM (which at that time owned a minority stake in Subaru parent company Fuji Heavy Industries), the effort was also supposed to spawn a Saab variant, but it never materialized. That’s no great loss for Saab, however, as the cramped and underpowered Tribeca is a sales flop. (Saab did sell a lightly made-over version of the Impreza wagon as the 9-2X for a time, beginning in 2004.)
